responses.welcome: Hi there! I'm BreastaBot, here to assist you with information about breast cancer and ways to cope with it. How can I help you today?

info_breast_cancer.description: Breast cancer is a disease where malignant (cancer) cells form in the tissues of the breast. It can start in different parts of the breast, such as the ducts or lobules.
info_breast_cancer.details: Early detection through screening and regular check-ups can significantly improve treatment outcomes. Let me know if you need more details!

symptoms.common: Common symptoms of breast cancer include a lump in the breast or underarm, changes in breast size or shape, swelling, and unusual discharge from the nipple.
symptoms.note: It's important to remember that these symptoms can also be caused by other conditions. Consulting a healthcare professional is crucial for an accurate diagnosis.

risk_factors.overview: Risk factors for breast cancer include being female, age, family history, genetic mutations like BRCA1 and BRCA2, and certain lifestyle factors such as alcohol consumption.
risk_factors.personal_risk: If you’re concerned about your risk, it’s best to discuss it with a healthcare provider who can offer personalized advice.

diagnosis.methods: Breast cancer is diagnosed through clinical breast exams, imaging tests like mammograms and ultrasounds, and biopsies to analyze tissue samples.
diagnosis.action: If your doctor recommends tests, following their advice is important for accurate diagnosis and effective treatment planning.

treatment_options.overview: Treatment options for breast cancer include surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, hormone therapy, targeted therapy, and immunotherapy, depending on the cancer type and stage.
treatment_options.personalized_care: Your oncologist will work with you to create a treatment plan tailored to your specific needs.

coping_strategies.support: Coping with breast cancer can be challenging. Seek support from friends, family, or support groups. Engage in activities that bring you joy and consider speaking with a counselor or therapist.
coping_strategies.self_care: Prioritizing self-care and staying informed about your condition can help you feel more in control.

resources.acs: American Cancer Society: [Visit ACS](https://www.cancer.org) for comprehensive information and support.
resources.breastcancer_org: BreastCancer.org: [Visit BreastCancer.org](https://www.breastcancer.org) for detailed information and resources.

responses.thanks: You’re welcome! If you have more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. Take care!
